section_header: Over the past two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems
field_label: 1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
3. Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
4. Feeling tired or having little energy?
5. Poor appetite or over eating
6. Feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
7. Trouble concentrating on things such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
8. Moving or speaking so slowly that other people have noticed. Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
1. On the whole, I am satisfied with myself
2. At times, I think I am no good at all
3. I feel that I have a number of good qualities
4. I am able to do things as well as most other people
5. I feel I do not have much to be proud of
6. I certainly feel useless at times
7. I feel that I'm a person of worth, at least on an equal plane with others.
8. I wish I could have more respect for myself
9. All in all, I am inclined to feel that I am a failure
10. I take a positive attitude towards myself.
Which category describes your walking situation closest?

select_choices_or_calculations.label: Normal: I may have some mild symptoms
Mild Disability: I have some noticeable symptoms from my MS but they are minor and have only a small effect on my lifestyle.
Moderate Disability: I do not have any limitations in my walking ability. However
Gait Disability: MS does interfere with my activities
Early Cane: I use a cane or a single crutch or some other form of support (such as touching a wall or leaning on someones arm) for walking all the time or part of the time
Late Cane: To be able to walk 25 feet
Bilateral Support: To be able to walk as far as 25 feet I must have 2 canes or crutches or a walker. I may use a scooter or wheelchair for longer distances.
Wheelchair / Scooter: My main form of mobility is a wheelchair. I may be able to stand and/or take one or two steps
Bedridden: Unable to sit in a wheelchair for more than one

field_annotation:
Instructions: Please read the choices listed below and choose the one that best describes your own situation.
This scale focuses mainly on how well you walk. You might not find a description that reflects
your condition exactly, but please mark the one category that describes your situation the closest.
